intro: Zeuxine montana, commonly known as the mountain zeuxine, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other herbaceous plants. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom in early summer. Zeuxine montana is characterized by its delicate foliage and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
